page.title: 01Small Dole
page.content: This is a rural area with 463 on the electoral register. Small Dole is a small village in the north of the area. The name Dole means a division of communal land, and the word Dal is still used in Sussex dailect to describe a strip of land. The main residential part of the village is to the east of the through road. Here are private houses and a small council estate. To the west is horticultural and agricultural land. Small Dole stands on a sandy ridge of land eminantly suitable for growing flowers and vegetables. Some householders sell these from their homes. The sandy ridge continues east as can be seen by local names, Tottington Sands, Truleigh Sands, Edburton and Perching Sands. There is a general store in Small Dole with sub Post Office, small village hall and public house.
